About Egna Le Egna

The Egna Le Egna Youth Health and Development Organization (ELEYHDO) was established in 1999, and registered as a non-profit voluntary organization in 2003 in Shashemene town, Ethiopia. Since inception, the organization has been working with of adolescent reproductive health, HIV/AIDS prevention, care and support, family planning, economic empowerment of unemployed youth, and nutrition promotion.

Over the years, Egna Le Egna has grown to provide a wide variety of programs concerning HIV/AIDS including prevention work through peer-educator drama and song clubs; establishing and running a Model Youth Center; home-based care to HIV/AIDS patients; medical treatment, care and education for orphans and vulnerable children; and home-to-home education and discussion with commercial sex workers. Egna Le Egna provides clear and concise information that empowers youth to be actively involved in HIV/AIDS prevention, working in partnership with community leaders dedicated to breaking the silence and stigma surrounding HIV/AIDS, and taking action to stop its spread through an integrated, community-based approach.

As a result of its good performance and public image, ELEYHDO was awarded various prizes from local and regional government. ELEYHDO leader also awarded the Federal Government award for her contribution in youth development work from President of Ethiopia. Currently the organization working in Shashemene , Kuyera , Arsi Negelle and Ajje towns and surrounding rural kebelles of ormoiya and three woredas of SNNPR. The organization established strong network and partnership with both state and non-state actors such as Dawn of Hope, Mekdim National Association, Family Guidance Association, Shashememe town Health Office, Youth and Sport Office, Shashememe town women child and youth Affair, Shashamane , Kuyera, Ajje and Arsi Negelle towns administration.



Vision

ELEYHDO aims to see a healthy and productive youth endowed with self-confidence and entrepreneurship

Mission

ELEYHDO is a local NGO aiming to create a healthy and productive youth in cooperation with governmental organizations, NGOs and active participation of community through undertaking programs in:

  • HIV/AIDS prevention, care and support
  • Adolescents social and reproductive health (ASRH)
  • Family Planning (FP)
  • Capacity building

Resources For Youth

  • COMPUTER LAB / SKILL DEVELOPMENT

    Thanks to generous donor support, alongside training and curation by ELEYHDO team members, local youth can use the computer lab to develop essential skills for the new economy.

  • LIBRARY / YOUTH EDUCATION

    The Egna Le Egna library contains both fictional and non-fiction educational material, to encourage and nurture curiosity of youth regardless of their interests and needs.

  • ATHLETICS / CONFIDENCE AND HEALTH

    Coupled with our active programs in physical and intellectual health and wellbeing, our athletic facilities give youth an opportunity to build healthy fitness habits.
